goals.title: Pray for Good Crop
goals.flavor: A humble olive farmer bows low, his palms still stained with earth. The rains came late, and his trees bear little fruit. He prays that the gods turn their gaze kindly upon his orchard before hunger sets in.

goals.title: Pray for Rain
goals.flavor: A shepherd from the uplands arrives, his lips cracked with thirst. The wells are drying and his flocks stumble in the dust. He begs for rain, even if it comes with thunder and flood.

goals.title: Pray Against Locusts
goals.flavor: A farmer brings a jar filled with ruined grain. He says the skies darken each evening with locusts, devouring everything green. He pleads for a cleansing wind to drive them away.

goals.title: Pray for the Vineyard
goals.flavor: An aging vintner speaks softly, smelling faintly of sour grapes. His vines wither under a strange blight. He offers his best amphora and asks for the strength of the earth to return.

goals.title: Pray for the Herd
goals.flavor: A goatherd kneels, holding a bell from his lost flock. Wolves came down from the hills at night. He prays the gods watch over what few animals remain.

goals.title: Pray for Fertile Fields
goals.flavor: A young couple from the river valley comes together, hands clasped. Their field was once rich, now it yields nothing but weeds. They ask the gods to restore life to the soil.

goals.title: Pray for the Beehives
goals.flavor: A beekeeper bows, face swollen from stings. The bees have gone mad, abandoning their hives. He begs for calm and the return of sweet honey.

goals.title: Pray for Victory
goals.flavor: A soldier’s wife leaves a lock of her hair on the altar. Her husband fights beyond the mountains. She prays his sword strike true and his shield never fail.

goals.title: Pray for Safe Return
goals.flavor: An old mother brings a handful of ashes from the hearth. Her sons have not written in months. She prays for news — good or bad — to reach her door.

goals.title: Pray for Peace
goals.flavor: Two traders argue outside the temple steps, each accusing the other’s city of greed. They finally kneel together, asking the gods to still the drums of war before ruin claims all.

goals.title: Pray for Protection from Raiders
goals.flavor: A farmer from the borderlands shows scars on his arm. His village was burned once before. He prays the gods guard their walls this harvest.

goals.title: Pray for Courage
goals.flavor: A young conscript trembles as he speaks. He is to march tomorrow, though his heart quails. He begs for courage enough to face the spears without shame.

goals.title: Pray for the Fallen
goals.flavor: A widow sets down a soldier’s broken helmet. She asks the gods to guide his spirit to the Fields of Glory and not let him wander among shades.

goals.title: Pray for Healing
goals.flavor: A mother’s eyes are red from sleepless nights. Her child coughs blood into linen rags. She offers the child’s toy and prays for a cure no physician has found.

goals.title: Pray for Relief from Plague
goals.flavor: A weary messenger dares not step close. In his city, a sickness has emptied the streets. He pleads for mercy before the pestilence spreads further.

goals.title: Pray for Safe Birth
goals.flavor: A pregnant woman clutches a charm of bone and twine. She whispers that two children before were stillborn. She prays that this one draws breath and lives to see the dawn.

goals.title: Pray for the Midwife
goals.flavor: The village midwife herself kneels, hands trembling. Too many births have gone wrong lately. She begs for steady hands and favor in her work.

goals.title: Pray for the Blind
goals.flavor: A beggar guided by his daughter touches the cold temple stones. He asks not for sight restored, but for the girl’s kindness to never fade.

goals.title: Pray for the Lame
goals.flavor: A man hobbles forward on a broken staff. He says his injury is punishment from the gods. He prays for forgiveness, or at least for the pain to ease.

goals.title: Pray for Long Life
goals.flavor: An old matron lays a garland of withered flowers. She has outlived her husband and sons. She prays for just one more summer to tend their graves.

goals.title: Pray for Trade Winds
goals.flavor: A sailor places a copper coin on the altar. His ship lies waiting for wind in the harbor. He prays for breath from the west to fill his sails.

goals.title: Pray for Prosperity
goals.flavor: A merchant bows deeply, his robe heavy with embroidered gold. His caravans have gone missing on the road. He prays their return, and swears to donate a tenth of their worth.

goals.title: Pray for a Good Market
goals.flavor: A young potter brings his unsold wares. He says people no longer buy his jars, claiming a curse upon his kiln. He prays for his craft to be favored again.

goals.title: Pray for the Fishermen
goals.flavor: A group of fishermen come together, smelling of salt and fear. The sea has turned strange — fish vanish, nets come up empty. They ask the sea god’s pardon for some unknown offense.

goals.title: Pray for Honest Weight
goals.flavor: A shopkeeper offers his bronze scale. He fears his rivals cheat their customers. He prays for fairness — or that their deceit be found out.

goals.title: Pray for the Shepherd
goals.flavor: A shepherd girl speaks shyly. She says lightning struck near her flock, and now the animals refuse to graze. She prays to calm their hearts, and her own.

goals.title: Pray for Tools
goals.flavor: A blacksmith lays a cracked hammer on the altar. His forge fire burns low, and every blade he makes turns brittle. He prays that the flame spirit forgive his neglect.

goals.title: Pray for Justice
goals.flavor: A widow kneels with her husband’s signet ring. The magistrate dismissed her case for lack of witnesses. She prays for truth to find its voice.

goals.title: Pray for Forgiveness
goals.flavor: A tax collector arrives late, his face hidden beneath a hood. He spills coins at the altar, whispering that they were taken unjustly. He begs the gods to judge him lightly.

goals.title: Pray for Mercy
goals.flavor: A thief caught by the guards stands before you in chains. He says he stole bread only for his starving sister. He prays for mercy, not for himself but for her.

goals.title: Pray for Truth
goals.flavor: A woman accused of witchcraft pleads her innocence. She offers the gods her own hair, saying: let truth be known, whether it condemns or saves her.

goals.title: Pray for Retribution
goals.flavor: A father’s eyes burn with grief. His daughter was taken by slavers, and no one dares pursue. He prays for vengeance, even if it damns his soul.

goals.title: Pray for Judgment
goals.flavor: An old judge enters silently. He confesses to condemning the innocent for bribes. Now the faces of the dead haunt his dreams. He prays for release — or punishment.

goals.title: Pray for Union
goals.flavor: Two young lovers come secretly after sunset. Their families forbid their marriage. They pray for the courage to defy blood and tradition.

goals.title: Pray for Fidelity
goals.flavor: A wife leaves a ring of woven reeds. She says her husband travels often and returns colder each time. She prays that his heart stay bound to hers.

goals.title: Pray for Child
goals.flavor: A barren couple kneels together, eyes downcast. They have prayed in every shrine but yours. They offer a dove and a promise: if a child is born, they will name it after your god.

goals.title: Pray for Family Peace
goals.flavor: A merchant’s household is torn by quarrel. Brothers fight over inheritance before the father is cold in his tomb. He prays for harmony before blood is spilled.

goals.title: Pray for Lost Love
goals.flavor: A young man places a single flower on the altar. The woman he loves has married another. He prays to forget her face, though he knows he never will.

goals.title: Pray for the Dead
goals.flavor: A gravedigger bows with dust still clinging to his hands. He buries the nameless poor, and dreams of them calling his name. He prays they rest, and leave him in peace.

goals.title: Pray for the Unburied
goals.flavor: A traveler brings word of corpses left on the battlefield. He fears their souls wander in torment. He prays for the gods of passage to open their gates.

goals.title: Pray for Peaceful Passing
goals.flavor: An elder sits quietly before the altar, eyes closed. “My time is near,” he says. “Let death come gently, not as thief but as friend.”

goals.title: Pray Against Haunting
goals.flavor: A widow speaks of strange sounds and cold breath at night. She fears her husband’s spirit lingers, angry at her remarriage. She prays for his forgiveness — or his departure.

goals.title: Pray for the Midday Shade
goals.flavor: A shepherd says the noonday sun has voices that whisper his name. He fears he’s being called to the underworld too soon. He prays to silence them.

goals.title: Pray for Guidance
goals.flavor: A youth enters trembling, uncertain which trade to pursue. He asks the gods to mark his path, lest he waste his life chasing shadows.

goals.title: Pray to Lift a Curse
goals.flavor: A woman carries a cracked idol. Her household has known only misfortune since her husband mocked the priest. She prays to appease the offended spirit.

goals.title: Pray for Favor
goals.flavor: A nobleman offers a white ram. He wants his name sung in temples across the land. He prays for divine favor to match his ambition.

goals.title: Pray for a Sign
goals.flavor: A hermit returns from the mountains claiming to have seen omens — black birds circling the sun. He prays for understanding before madness takes him.

goals.title: Pray for the Temple
goals.flavor: An acolyte of your own order kneels. The temple roof leaks, offerings have grown meager. He prays for renewed faith among the people.

goals.title: Pray for Strength of Faith
goals.flavor: A young novice admits doubt has crept into his heart. He fears the gods no longer hear him. He prays not for proof, but for the will to keep believing.

goals.title: Pray Against Heresy
goals.flavor: A stern priest from another town arrives, accusing his flock of following false idols. He prays for power to cleanse his parish — and for the courage to do what must be done.

petitions.title: Pray for Protection from Nightmares
petitions.flavor: A boy claims a pale woman visits his dreams each night, whispering secrets in a dead tongue. He prays for sleep without voices.

petitions.title: Pray for Deliverance from Spirits
petitions.flavor: A fisherman says something followed him from the sea — shapes in the fog, whispering his name. He prays for banishment of the unseen.

petitions.title: Pray for Rain of Fire
petitions.flavor: An old prophet raves in the square, claiming only fire will cleanse the world. He prays for the skies to burn. The crowd murmurs in fear.

petitions.title: Pray for the Moon’s Return
petitions.flavor: An astrologer kneels in panic. The moon has vanished behind an endless cloud, and tides no longer obey. He prays for the celestial order to be restored.

petitions.title: Pray for the Talking Statue
petitions.flavor: A merchant’s son swears the statue in his courtyard spoke last night. He prays to know whether it was miracle or curse.

petitions.title: Pray for the Serpent Beneath
petitions.flavor: A miner speaks of rumblings deep under the hills. He says a serpent god stirs in its sleep. He prays for the earth to remain sealed.

petitions.title: Pray for the Return of Light
petitions.flavor: A traveler from the north claims the sun failed to rise for three days. He prays for dawn to come again, before the world forgets what warmth feels like.

category.notes: Categories group thematic goals; id is slug used for optional goal tagging.

goal.notes: Each goal object originates from a petition narrative; used for optional goal templates.
